deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text: @dev interface defining the TokenRecipient

@notice Prevents contract from accepting ETHs
 @dev Contracts can still be sent ETH with self destruct. If anyone deliberately does that, the ETHs will be lost

@title AdvancedOToken
 @author Phoenix

@dev ID of the executing chain
 @return uint value
@dev interface defining the TokenRecipient

@notice Prevents contract from accepting ETHs
 @dev Contracts can still be sent ETH with self destruct. If anyone deliberately does that, the ETHs will be lost

@title AdvancedOToken
 @author Phoenix

@dev ID of the executing chain
 @return uint value

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

calculateCommissionMint(uint256).details: Does not checks if sender/recipient is whitelisted

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

params.data: The data supplied by token contract. It will be ignored

transfer(address,uint256).details: overriden Function of the openzeppelin ERC20 contract

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: overriden Function of the openzeppelin ERC20 contract

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

transferToken(uint256,address).details: Only owner can call, tokens will be transferred and equivalent amount of Token will be burnt from owner address.

params._amount: the amount of tokens to be transferred

calculateCommissionMyTokenCrw(uint256).notice: check transer fee credited to Token owner

calculateCommissionPhoenixCrw(uint256).notice: check transer fee credited to Phoenix

tokenFallback(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Function called by token contract whenever tokens are deposited to this contract

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Standard transfer function to Transfer token

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Standard transferFrom. Send tokens on behalf of spender

updateCommssionMint(uint256,uint256).notice: Update commission to be charged on token minting

updateCommssionMyTokenTranfer(uint256,ui.notice: Update commission to be charged on token transfer

updateCommssionPhoenixTransfer(uint256,u.notice: Update commission to be charged on each token transfer for Phoenix

updatePhoenixAddress(address).notice: update phoenix wallet address. This address will be responsible for holding commission on tokens transfer
